H0.text: Mass and volume are the two characteristics that affect a planet's gravitational attraction to the Sun.

H1.text: Volume and length of day are the two characteristics that affect a planet's gravitational attraction to the Sun.

H2.text: Distance from the Sun and mass are the two characteristics that affect a planet's gravitational attraction to the Sun.

H3.text: Length of day and distance from the Sun affect a planet's gravitational attraction to the Sun.

A4.text: The gravitational force acting between two objects is proportional to the product of their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between their centers of mass.

A5.text: Newton's law of universal gravitation is often said to be the low-gravity limit of general relativity.
